results.title: Direct activation of endothelial cells by SARS-CoV-2 nucleocapsid protein is blocked by Simvastatin
results.text_hl: In conclusion, the study provides insights on @SPECIES_2697049 @@@SARS-CoV-2@@@-induced @DISEASE_Livedoid_Vasculopathy @DISEASE_MESH:D000090122 @@@vasculopathy@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Coagulation_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001778 @@@coagulopathy@@@, and suggests that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, an FDA-approved @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@-lowering drug, may benefit to prevent the pathogenesis and improve the outcome of @DISEASE_COVID_19 @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

results.title: Simvastatin attenuates vascular hypercoagulability in cardiac transplant recipients.
results.text_hl: The reduction of monocyte @GENE_F3 @GENE_2152 @@@TF@@@ activity during treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ paralleled with the normalization of elevated levels of @GENE_F2 @GENE_2147 @@@thrombin@@@-antithrombin complex, @GENE_F2 @GENE_2147 @@@prothrombin@@@ fragment F1+2, and D-dimer, which are markers of @GENE_F2 @GENE_2147 @@@thrombin@@@ and fibrin formation indicating @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Coagulation_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001778 @@@coagulation@@@ activation after cardiac transplantation.
